title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 120.1 - Undivided profits defined
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 120.1 - Undivided profits defined

State Regulations

For purposes of Article III of the Banking Law, the term
undivided profits includes paid-in or earned profits (unearned income must be
deducted); reserves for loan losses or bad debts; valuation reserves for
securities; and reserves for contingencies. It does not include reserves for
dividends declared or reserves for taxes, interest and
expenses. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3

120.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
